findings.title: External call before fund transfer allows reentrancy
findings.explanation: The contract performs an external call to a target address before transferring the contract balance to the owner without any reentrancy guard. A malicious target contract can reenter `go()` and manipulate the flow of funds or trigger unexpected behavior.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern: perform all internal state changes before external calls, or employ a reentrancy guard (e.g., OpenZeppelin’s ReentrancyGuard) to prevent recursive calls.

findings.title: Unverified return value of low-level call
findings.explanation: The contract uses `target.call.value(msg.value)()` without checking its return value. If the call fails, execution continues silently and may lead to incorrect assumptions about ether transfer success.
findings.fix_suggestion: Check the boolean return value of the low-level call and revert on failure, for example: `require(target.call.value(msg.value)());`.

unmatched_predictions.title: External call before fund transfer allows reentrancy
Unverified return value of low-level call
